</script>

<script>
(function() {
	'use strict';

	const fetches = {};
	const promises = {};
	const urls = {
		'wp-polyfill': '/wp-includes/js/dist/vendor/wp-polyfill.min.js?m=1764669441i&ver=3.15.0',
		'verbum': '/wp-content/mu-plugins/jetpack-mu-wpcom-plugin/sun/jetpack_vendor/automattic/jetpack-mu-wpcom/src/build/verbum-comments/verbum-comments.js?m=1765400473i&minify=false&ver=87a45c8962a448c74c1e'
	};
	const loaders = {
		'verbum': () => {
			fetchExternalScript('wp-polyfill');
			fetchExternalScript('verbum');
			promises['wp-polyfill'] = promises['wp-polyfill'] || loadWPScript('wp-polyfill');
			promises['verbum'] = promises['verbum'] || promises['wp-polyfill'].then( () => loadWPScript('verbum') );
			return promises['verbum'];
		},
		
	};
	const scriptExtras = {
		'verbum': { translations: 1, before: 0, after: 0 },
		
	};

	window.WP_Enqueue_Dynamic_Script = {
		loadScript: (handle) => {
			if (!loaders[handle]) {
				console.error('WP_Enqueue_Dynamic_Script: unregistered script `' + handle + '`.');
			}
			return loaders[handle]();
		}
	};

	function fetchExternalScript(handle) {
		if (!urls[handle]) {
			return Promise.resolve();
		}

		fetches[handle] = fetches[handle] || fetch(urls[handle], { mode: 'no-cors' });
		return fetches[handle];
	}

	function runExtraScript(handle, type, index) {
		const id = 'wp-enqueue-dynamic-script:' + handle + ':' + type + ':' + (index + 1);
		const template = document.getElementById(id);
		if (!template) {
			return Promise.reject();
		}

		const script = document.createElement( 'script' );
		script.innerHTML = template.innerHTML;
		document.body.appendChild( script );
		return Promise.resolve();
	}

	function loadExternalScript(handle) {
		if (!urls[handle]) {
			return Promise.resolve();
		}

		return fetches[handle].then(() => {
			return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
				const script = document.createElement('script');
				script.onload = () => resolve();
				script.onerror = (e) => reject(e);
				script.src = urls[handle];
				document.body.appendChild(script);
			});
		});
	}

	function loadExtra(handle, pos) {
		const count = (scriptExtras[handle] && scriptExtras[handle][pos]) || 0;
		let promise = Promise.resolve();

		for (let i = 0; i < count; i++) {
			promise = promise.then(() => runExtraScript(handle, pos, i));
		}

		return promise;
	}

	function loadWPScript(handle) {
		// Core loads scripts in this order. See: https://github.com/WordPress/WordPress/blob/a59eb9d39c4fcba834b70c9e8dfd64feeec10ba6/wp-includes/class-wp-scripts.php#L428.
		return loadExtra(handle, 'translations')
			.then(() => loadExtra(handle, 'before'))
			.then(() => loadExternalScript(handle))
			.then(() => loadExtra(handle, 'after'));
	}
} )();
</script>

</body>
</html>
<!doctype html>
<html lang="en-GB">
<head>
	<meta charset="UTF-8" />
	<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1" />
	<link rel="profile" href="https://gmpg.org/xfn/11" />
	<title>CHONKS: 25 BIG Fantasy Books &#8211; Spells and Spaceships</title>
<meta name='robots' content='max-image-preview:large' />

<!-- Async WordPress.com Remote Login -->
<script id="wpcom_remote_login_js">
var wpcom_remote_login_extra_auth = '';
function wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( element_id ) {
	var dom_node = document.getElementById( element_id );
	if ( dom_node ) { dom_node.parentNode.removeChild( dom_node ); }
}
function wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_classes( class_name ) {
	var dom_nodes = document.querySelectorAll( '.' + class_name );
	for ( var i = 0; i < dom_nodes.length; i++ ) {
		dom_nodes[ i ].parentNode.removeChild( dom_nodes[ i ] );
	}
}
function wpcom_remote_login_final_cleanup() {
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_classes( "wpcom_remote_login_msg" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_key" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_validate" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_js" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_request_access_iframe" );
	wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_request_access_styles" );
}

// Watch for messages back from the remote login
window.addEventListener( "message", function( e ) {
	if ( e.origin === "https://r-login.wordpress.com" ) {
		var data = {};
		try {
			data = JSON.parse( e.data );
		} catch( e ) {
			wpcom_remote_login_final_cleanup();
			return;
		}

		if ( data.msg === 'LOGIN' ) {
			// Clean up the login check iframe
			wpcom_remote_login_remove_dom_node_id( "wpcom_remote_login_key" );

			var id_regex = new RegExp( /^[0-9]+$/ );
			var token_regex = new RegExp( /^.*|.*|.*$/ );
			if (
				token_regex.test( data.token )
				&& id_regex.test( data.wpcomid )
			) {
				// We have everything we need to ask for a login
				var script = document.createElement( "script" );
				script.setAttribute( "id", "wpcom_remote_login_validate" );
				script.src = '/remote-login.php?wpcom_remote_login=validate'
					+ '&wpcomid=' + data.wpcomid
					+ '&token=' + encodeURIComponent( data.token )
					+ '&host=' + window.location.protocol
					+ '//' + window.location.hostname
					+ '&postid=3890'
					+ '&is_singular=1';
				document.body.appendChild( script );
			}

			return;
		}

		// Safari ITP, not logged in, so redirect
		if ( data.msg === 'LOGIN-REDIRECT' ) {
			window.location = 'https://wordpress.com/log-in?redirect_to=' + window.location.href;
			return;
		}

		// Safari ITP, storage access failed, remove the request
		if ( data.msg === 'LOGIN-REMOVE' ) {
			var css_zap = 'html { -webkit-transition: margin-top 1s; transition: margin-top 1s; } /* 9001 */ html { margin-top: 0 !important; } * html body { margin-top: 0 !important; } @media screen and ( max-width: 782px ) { html { margin-top: 0 !important; } * html body { margin-top: 0 !important; } }';
			var style_zap = document.createElement( 'style' );
			style_zap.type = 'text/css';
			style_zap.appendChild( document.createTextNode( css_zap ) );
			document.body.appendChild( style_zap );

			var e = document.getElementById( 'wpcom_request_access_iframe' );
			e.parentNode.removeChild( e );

			document.cookie = 'wordpress_com_login_access=denied; path=/; max-age=31536000';

			return;
		}

		// Safari ITP
		if ( data.msg === 'REQUEST_ACCESS' ) {
			console.log( 'request access: safari' );

			// Check ITP iframe enable/disable knob
			if ( wpcom_remote_login_extra_auth !== 'safari_itp_iframe' ) {
				return;
			}

			// If we are in a "private window" there is no ITP.
			var private_window = false;
			try {
				var opendb = window.openDatabase( null, null, null, null );
			} catch( e ) {
				private_window = true;
			}

			if ( private_window ) {
				console.log( 'private window' );
				return;
			}

			var iframe = document.createElement( 'iframe' );
			iframe.id = 'wpcom_request_access_iframe';
			iframe.setAttribute( 'scrolling', 'no' );
			iframe.setAttribute( 'sandbox', 'allow-storage-access-by-user-activation allow-scripts allow-same-origin allow-top-navigation-by-user-activation' );
			iframe.src = 'https://r-login.wordpress.com/remote-login.php?wpcom_remote_login=request_access&origin=' + encodeURIComponent( data.origin ) + '&wpcomid=' + encodeURIComponent( data.wpcomid );

			var css = 'html { -webkit-transition: margin-top 1s; transition: margin-top 1s; } /* 9001 */ html { margin-top: 46px !important; } * html body { margin-top: 46px !important; } @media screen and ( max-width: 660px ) { html { margin-top: 71px !important; } * html body { margin-top: 71px !important; } #wpcom_request_access_iframe { display: block; height: 71px !important; } } #wpcom_request_access_iframe { border: 0px; height: 46px; position: fixed; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; min-width: 100%; z-index: 99999; background: #23282d; } ';

			var style = document.createElement( 'style' );
			style.type = 'text/css';
			style.id = 'wpcom_request_access_styles';
			style.appendChild( document.createTextNode( css ) );
			document.body.appendChild( style );

			document.body.appendChild( iframe );
		}

		if ( data.msg === 'DONE' ) {
			wpcom_remote_login_final_cleanup();
		}
	}
}, false );

// Inject the remote login iframe after the page has had a chance to load
// more critical resources
window.addEventListener( "DOMContentLoaded", function( e ) {
	var iframe = document.createElement( "iframe" );
	iframe.style.display = "none";
	iframe.setAttribute( "scrolling", "no" );
	iframe.setAttribute( "id", "wpcom_remote_login_key" );
	iframe.src = "https://r-login.wordpress.com/remote-login.php"
		+ "?wpcom_remote_login=key"
		+ "&origin=aHR0cHM6Ly9zcGVsbHNhbmRzcGFjZXNoaXBzLmhvbWUuYmxvZw%3D%3D"
		+ "&wpcomid=169551066"
		+ "&time=" + Math.floor( Date.now() / 1000 );
	document.body.appendChild( iframe );
}, false );
</script>

	<script type="text/javascript">
		/* <![CDATA[ */
		function addLoadEvent(func) {
			var oldonload = window.onload;
			if (typeof window.onload != 'function') {
				window.onload = func;
			} else {
				window.onload = function () {
					oldonload();
					func();
				}
			}
		}
		/* ]]> */
	</script>

				var linkElements = [
					'a[href="https://wordpress.com/?ref=footer_blog"]',
					'a[href="https://wordpress.com/?ref=footer_website"]',
					'a[href="https://wordpress.com/?ref=vertical_footer"]',
					'a[href^="https://wordpress.com/?ref=footer_segment_"]',
				].join(',');

				var dnsLink = document.createElement( 'a' );
				dnsLink.href = 'https://wordpress.com/advertising-program-optout/';
				dnsLink.classList.add( 'do-not-sell-link' );
				dnsLink.rel = 'nofollow';
				dnsLink.style.marginLeft = '0.5em';
				dnsLink.textContent = 'Do Not Sell or Share My Personal Information';

				var creditLinks = document.querySelectorAll( linkElements );

				if ( 0 === creditLinks.length ) {
					return false;
				}

				Array.prototype.forEach.call( creditLinks, function( el ) {
					el.insertAdjacentElement( 'afterend', dnsLink );
				});

				return true;
			};

		</script>

	<div id="content" class="site-content">

	<section id="primary" class="content-area">
		<main id="main" class="site-main">

			
<article id="post-3890" class="post-3890 post type-post status-publish format-standard has-post-thumbnail hentry category-features entry">

	<header class="entry-header responsive-max-width">
		<h1 class="entry-title">CHONKS: 25 BIG Fantasy&nbsp;Books</h1>				<div class="entry-meta">
			<span class="byline"><svg class="svg-icon" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true" role="img" focusable="false" viewBox="0 0 24 24" version="1.1" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"><path d="M12 12c2.21 0 4-1.79 4-4s-1.79-4-4-4-4 1.79-4 4 1.79 4 4 4zm0 2c-2.67 0-8 1.34-8 4v2h16v-2c0-2.66-5.33-4-8-4z"></path><path d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"></path></svg><span class="screen-reader-text">Posted by</span><span class="author vcard"><a class="url fn n" href="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/author/spellsandspaceships/">Spells and Spaceships</a></span></span><span class="posted-on"><svg class="svg-icon" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true" role="img" focusable="false" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><defs><path id="a" d="M0 0h24v24H0V0z"></path></defs><clipPath id="b"><use xlink:href="#a" overflow="visible"></use></clipPath><path clip-path="url(#b)" d="M12 2C6.5 2 2 6.5 2 12s4.5 10 10 10 10-4.5 10-10S17.5 2 12 2zm4.2 14.2L11 13V7h1.5v5.2l4.5 2.7-.8 1.3z"></path></svg><a href="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/" rel="bookmark"><time class="entry-date published" datetime="2023-04-01T16:48:26+01:00">1st Apr 2023</time><time class="updated" datetime="2024-02-18T20:56:50+00:00">18th Feb 2024</time></a></span><span class="cat-links"><svg class="svg-icon" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true" role="img" focusable="false" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 0 24 24"><path d="M10 4H4c-1.1 0-1.99.9-1.99 2L2 18c0 1.1.9 2 2 2h16c1.1 0 2-.9 2-2V8c0-1.1-.9-2-2-2h-8l-2-2z"></path><path d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"></path></svg><span class="screen-reader-text">Posted in</span><a href="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/category/features/" rel="category tag">Features</a></span>		</div><!-- .meta-info -->
			</header>

	
			<figure class="post-thumbnail">
				<img width="1000" height="750" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/photo-1462622437620-30b99c08d621.jpeg?w=1000" class="attachment-post-thumbnail size-post-thumbnail wp-post-image" alt="" decoding="async" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/photo-1462622437620-30b99c08d621.jpeg 1000w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/photo-1462622437620-30b99c08d621.jpeg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/photo-1462622437620-30b99c08d621.jpeg?w=300 300w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/photo-1462622437620-30b99c08d621.jpeg?w=768 768w" sizes="(max-width: 1000px) 100vw, 1000px" data-attachment-id="3936" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/photo-1462622437620-30b99c08d621/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/photo-1462622437620-30b99c08d621.jpeg" data-orig-size="1000,750" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="photo-1462622437620-30b99c08d621" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/photo-1462622437620-30b99c08d621.jpeg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/photo-1462622437620-30b99c08d621.jpeg?w=750" />			</figure><!-- .post-thumbnail -->

		
	<div class="entry-content">
		
<p>Hi all, today&#8217;s post is going to introduce you to the chonkosaurus, the chonkopottomus, the chonkodon. The thicc book you could use to neutralise an intruder. To wedge a bank vault open. To prop up the leaning tower of Pisa like sliding a beermat under a wonky table. </p>



<p>These books are all 600 pages plus and if you order online, will be forced to wait around in your pyjamas for the beast to arrive (no that&#8217;s not what I call my delivery driver), such is its inability to fit through letter boxes or catflaps, or be wedged into a mailbox. Your other option is heading out to a book shop with a friend to help you carry it home. </p>



<p>Some of the following books I have read myself, whilst many of them come recommended from the book community. These books are possibly the only things on earth to train both your mind and your physical strength at exactly the same time.</p>



<p>Of course, there is one solution: audiobooks!</p>



<p>I hope you enjoy looking through these chonky books. Follow your manual handling principles if attempting to pick one up&#8230;</p>



<p>*please note &#8211; the page count may vary by the edition or format of the book. Page counts mostly based on paperback version. </p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">The Grace of Kings by Ken Liu &#8211; 640 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3920" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/6b30dd_21e8b974ea2d4b5cb137115c6dfed2c3_mv2/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/6b30dd_21e8b974ea2d4b5cb137115c6dfed2c3_mv2.jpg" data-orig-size="680,680" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}" data-image-title="6b30dd_21e8b974ea2d4b5cb137115c6dfed2c3_mv2" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/6b30dd_21e8b974ea2d4b5cb137115c6dfed2c3_mv2.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/6b30dd_21e8b974ea2d4b5cb137115c6dfed2c3_mv2.jpg?w=680" width="680" height="680" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/6b30dd_21e8b974ea2d4b5cb137115c6dfed2c3_mv2.jpg?w=680" alt="" class="wp-image-3920" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/6b30dd_21e8b974ea2d4b5cb137115c6dfed2c3_mv2.jpg 680w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/6b30dd_21e8b974ea2d4b5cb137115c6dfed2c3_mv2.jpg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/6b30dd_21e8b974ea2d4b5cb137115c6dfed2c3_mv2.jpg?w=300 300w" sizes="(max-width: 680px) 100vw, 680px" /></figure>



<p>L. L. MacRae: &#8220;I love how much this book shows us about human nature. About how history repeats. About trying to avoid mistakes of the past cause new ones to happen. About how it might not be enough for people to do better or have good intentions, but they try anyway. About changing your fate and making the best of what you have.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Battle Mage by Peter Flannery &#8211; 648 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3922" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/image_editor_output_image-44947887-1680344354909/" <p>Blaise for Under The Radar SFF Books: &#8220;If you need a complete story on a epic scale, this is the book for you&#8230; I will be recommending this book for the rest of my days as a blogger&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Gardens of the Moon by Steven Eriskon &#8211; 657 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3919" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/xgotm1-752x1003-jpg-pagespeed-ic-ejrko9rl3d-2/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/xgotm1-752x1003.jpg.pagespeed.ic_.ejrko9rl3d.jpeg" data-orig-size="752,1003" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="xgotm1-752&amp;#215;1003.jpg.pagespeed.ic.eJRKO9rL3d" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/xgotm1-752x1003.jpg.pagespeed.ic_.ejrko9rl3d.jpeg?w=225" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/xgotm1-752x1003.jpg.pagespeed.ic_.ejrko9rl3d.jpeg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="752" height="1003" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/xgotm1-752x1003.jpg.pagespeed.ic_.ejrko9rl3d.jpeg?w=752" alt="" class="wp-image-3919" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/xgotm1-752x1003.jpg.pagespeed.ic_.ejrko9rl3d.jpeg 752w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/xgotm1-752x1003.jpg.pagespeed.ic_.ejrko9rl3d.jpeg?w=112 112w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/xgotm1-752x1003.jpg.pagespeed.ic_.ejrko9rl3d.jpeg?w=225 225w" sizes="(max-width: 752px) 100vw, 752px" /></figure>



<p>Tommye from The Fantasy Review: &#8220;<em>Gardens of the Moon</em>&nbsp;is one of the best&nbsp;fantasy books<strong>&nbsp;</strong>I have ever read. The world is rich and its history angry and proud.&nbsp;Steven Erikson’s first book in&nbsp;<em>Malazan Book of the Fallen</em>&nbsp;is a masterpiece.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Legacy of the Brightwash by Krystle Matar &#8211; 662 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3904" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/rm_mr1521_krystle-matar-02-1024x660/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/rm_mr1521_krystle-matar-02-1024x660-1.jpg" data-orig-size="1024,660" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="RM_MR1521_Krystle-Matar-02-1024&amp;#215;660" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/rm_mr1521_krystle-matar-02-1024x660-1.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/rm_mr1521_krystle-matar-02-1024x660-1.jpg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="660" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/rm_mr1521_krystle-matar-02-1024x660-1.jpg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-3904" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/rm_mr1521_krystle-matar-02-1024x660-1.jpg 1024w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/rm_mr1521_krystle-matar-02-1024x660-1.jpg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/rm_mr1521_krystle-matar-02-1024x660-1.jpg?w=300 300w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/rm_mr1521_krystle-matar-02-1024x660-1.jpg?w=768 768w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" /></figure>



<p>Rebecca Crunden: &#8220;As magical and mysterious as <em>Carnival Row</em>, as upsetting and filled with warning as <em>1984</em>, as harrowing and heartbreaking as <em>The Ones Who Walk Away from Omelas</em>, as powerful and painful as <em>V For Vendetta</em>, and as dark and twisty as <em>The Alienist</em>, Brightwash honestly blew me away.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">The Name of the Wind by Patrick Rothfuss &#8211; 662 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3906" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/s-l1600/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/s-l1600.jpg" data-orig-size="1600,1600" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="s-l1600" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/s-l1600.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/s-l1600.jpg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="1024" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/s-l1600.jpg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-3906" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/s-l1600.jpg?w=1024 1024w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/s-l1600.jpg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/s-l1600.jpg?w=300 300w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/s-l1600.jpg?w=768 768w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/s-l1600.jpg?w=1440 1440w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/s-l1600.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" /></figure>



<p>Petrik Leo for Novel Notions: &#8220;It&#8217;s meticulous, brilliantly unputdownable, elegant, lyrical, and poetic. It&#8217;s evident how the fourteen years of revision and editing brought fruition to this absolutely marvelous result.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Malice &#8211; 672 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3905" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/4b83485f25ecc1880c4cd4b1bf35186f/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/4b83485f25ecc1880c4cd4b1bf35186f.jpg" data-orig-size="480,640" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="4b83485f25ecc1880c4cd4b1bf35186f" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/4b83485f25ecc1880c4cd4b1bf35186f.jpg?w=225" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/4b83485f25ecc1880c4cd4b1bf35186f.jpg?w=480" loading="lazy" width="480" height="640" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/4b83485f25ecc1880c4cd4b1bf35186f.jpg?w=480" alt="" class="wp-image-3905" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/4b83485f25ecc1880c4cd4b1bf35186f.jpg 480w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/4b83485f25ecc1880c4cd4b1bf35186f.jpg?w=113 113w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/4b83485f25ecc1880c4cd4b1bf35186f.jpg?w=225 225w" sizes="(max-width: 480px) 100vw, 480px" /></figure>



<p>Sam at The Book in Hand: &#8220;This book has made me care about the characters in a way no other writer has ever managed, and not just one or two of the lead characters. Every. Single. One. Of. Them. It has left me breathless, had me laughing out loud, scowling at the pages and damned near crying.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">The Dragonbone Chair &#8211; 672 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3914" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/sorrow-memory-thorn_williams/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/sorrow-memory-thorn_williams.jpg" data-orig-size="978,587" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="Sorrow-Memory-Thorn_Williams" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/sorrow-memory-thorn_williams.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/sorrow-memory-thorn_williams.jpg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="978" height="587" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/sorrow-memory-thorn_williams.jpg?w=978" alt="" class="wp-image-3914" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/sorrow-memory-thorn_williams.jpg 978w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/sorrow-memory-thorn_williams.jpg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/sorrow-memory-thorn_williams.jpg?w=300 300w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/sorrow-memory-thorn_williams.jpg?w=768 768w" sizes="(max-width: 978px) 100vw, 978px" /></figure>



<p>FantasyBookReview: &#8220;This is epic fantasy, nearly 800 pages of it and it lasts the pace well. The Dragonbone Chair brings together all the elements that are found in many a fantasy book and re-produces them in a beautiful and endearing way.&#8221;</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Royal Assassin &#8211; 675 pages (Assassin&#8217;s Quest is even bigger at 869 pages)</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3903" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/img-2895-1024x897/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/img-2895-1024x897-1.jpg" data-orig-size="1024,897" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;1509724654&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="IMG-2895-1024&amp;#215;897" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/img-2895-1024x897-1.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/img-2895-1024x897-1.jpg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="897" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/img-2895-1024x897-1.jpg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-3903" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/img-2895-1024x897-1.jpg 1024w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/img-2895-1024x897-1.jpg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/img-2895-1024x897-1.jpg?w=300 300w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/img-2895-1024x897-1.jpg?w=768 768w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" /></figure>



<p>Alex Nieves: &#8220;Wow what a followup and absolutely beautifully tragic story Robin Hobb has created here. Easily one of the best books I&#8217;ve read this year. Hobb improved on Assassin&#8217;s Apprentice in damn near every conceivable way with this entry. It&#8217;s full of great characters, tragic storylines, and absolutely gorgeous writing. The hype and praise is to be believed for this book, that was excellent.&#8221;</p>



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Theft of Swords &#8211; 691 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3907" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/dsc03300/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dsc03300.jpg" data-orig-size="648,432" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="DSC03300" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dsc03300.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dsc03300.jpg?w=648" loading="lazy" width="648" height="432" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dsc03300.jpg?w=648" alt="" class="wp-image-3907" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dsc03300.jpg 648w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dsc03300.jpg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dsc03300.jpg?w=300 300w" sizes="(max-width: 648px) 100vw, 648px" /></figure>



<p>Nils Shukla for The Fantasy Hive: &#8220;<em>Theft of Swords&nbsp;</em>really embodies the high fantasy genre, it includes organically likable characters and a world so wonderfully layered there is always more to uncover&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Northern Wrath &#8211; 700 pages </h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3902" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/ffvfwdvxeaqec8w/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/ffvfwdvxeaqec8w.jpg" data-orig-size="1200,900" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="FfVfwdVXEAQeC8W" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/ffvfwdvxeaqec8w.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/ffvfwdvxeaqec8w.jpg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="768" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/ffvfwdvxeaqec8w.jpg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-3902" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/ffvfwdvxeaqec8w.jpg?w=1024 1024w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/ffvfwdvxeaqec8w.jpg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/ffvfwdvxeaqec8w.jpg?w=300 300w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/ffvfwdvxeaqec8w.jpg?w=768 768w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/ffvfwdvxeaqec8w.jpg 1200w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" /></figure>



<p>Alex at Spells &amp; Spaceships (me!): &#8220;Well, this book has everything – and it really does. It’s both plot and character driven. It has revenge storylines. It has self discovery and redemption, sacrifice and adventure. It has family and friendship themes. Romance, loss and pure berserker brutality.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Jade Legacy &#8211; 713 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3901" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/e_rhzj3vgaqodm2/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/e_rhzj3vgaqodm2.jpg" data-orig-size="768,1024" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="E_RHZJ3VgAQodm2" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/e_rhzj3vgaqodm2.jpg?w=225" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/e_rhzj3vgaqodm2.jpg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="768" height="1024" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/e_rhzj3vgaqodm2.jpg?w=768" alt="" class="wp-image-3901" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/e_rhzj3vgaqodm2.jpg 768w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/e_rhzj3vgaqodm2.jpg?w=113 113w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/e_rhzj3vgaqodm2.jpg?w=225 225w" sizes="(max-width: 768px) 100vw, 768px" /></figure>



<p>Benedict, creator of the SFF Oasis: &#8220;It&#8217;s a book that is perfect in every way and surpasses the standard 5 star system. Every word has been placed down with thought as if there was a word limit and not single consonant or vowel could be wasted. Fonda has written something utterly brilliant here that everyone needs to experience.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />

<p>Fiona Denton for Grimdark Magazine: &#8220;Although this is Jackson’s first novel it is a clearly established, believable world and Illborn feels like a small part of something massive. I am genuinely excited to explore this world further and expect great things from this series.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">The Shadow of What Was Lost &#8211; 736 pages</h2>

<p>David S for FanfiAddict: &#8220;The author interweaves converging plotlines seamlessly into a satisfying climax and an incredible epilogue that made me want to start reading the next novel almost immediately, which I did.&#8221;</p>

<p>Trin at Portable Magic: &#8220;Wow&#8230; Just&#8230; Wow! This book is everything I have been wanting from a vampire novel for YEARS! I am at a loss of what to say&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">The Lies of Locke Lamora &#8211; 752 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3913" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/lies-of-locke-lamora-all/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/lies-of-locke-lamora-all.jpg" data-orig-size="1600,1370" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;1.5&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;DMC-LX7&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;1389721007&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;5.9&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;400&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0.025&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}" data-image-title="Lies-of-Locke-Lamora-all" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/lies-of-locke-lamora-all.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/lies-of-locke-lamora-all.jpg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="876" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/lies-of-locke-lamora-all.jpg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-3913" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/lies-of-locke-lamora-all.jpg?w=1024 1024w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/lies-of-locke-lamora-all.jpg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/lies-of-locke-lamora-all.jpg?w=300 300w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/lies-of-locke-lamora-all.jpg?w=768 768w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/lies-of-locke-lamora-all.jpg?w=1440 1440w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/lies-of-locke-lamora-all.jpg 1600w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" /></figure>



<p>Matt&#8217;s Fantasy Book Reviews: &#8220;This is a fantastic fantasy novel that I happily can say is in my &#8220;top 10&#8221;.<br /><br />I loved everything about this book. The characters are wonderfully written, the world is thoroughly enjoyable (even though it&#8217;s on a very small scale), the plot is extremely engaging, the twists are exciting and shocking, and the ending is fantastic.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Eleventh Cycle &#8211; 779 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3897" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/m49114001154_2/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/m49114001154_2.jpg" data-orig-size="1080,1080" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="m49114001154_2" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/m49114001154_2.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/m49114001154_2.jpg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="1024" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/m49114001154_2.jpg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-3897" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/m49114001154_2.jpg?w=1024 1024w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/m49114001154_2.jpg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/m49114001154_2.jpg?w=300 300w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/m49114001154_2.jpg?w=768 768w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/m49114001154_2.jpg 1080w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" /></figure>



<p>Nick Borelli at Out of This World SFF: &#8220;Eleventh Cycle is a book that can horrify you one minute and then touch every heartstring in your being the next. That&#8217;s an incredibly tricky thing to pull off but Ardalan does it like a skilled maestro. If you&#8217;re tired of getting spoon-fed the same predictable tropes in your fantasy books, you really should make this book your next read. It will challenge you in a way that not too many fantasy books dare to. And along the way you will be treated to some outstanding worldbuilding, egotistical gods, magical creatures born of nightmares, and some of the very best writing out there.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Legacy of Ash &#8211; 800 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3912" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/eiyhas-w4auuzv/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/eiyhas-w4auuzv-.jpeg" data-orig-size="3731,2678" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="EIyHAs-W4AUUzv-" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/eiyhas-w4auuzv-.jpeg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/eiyhas-w4auuzv-.jpeg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="734" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/eiyhas-w4auuzv-.jpeg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-3912" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/eiyhas-w4auuzv-.jpeg?w=1024 1024w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/eiyhas-w4auuzv-.jpeg?w=2048 2048w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/eiyhas-w4auuzv-.jpeg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/eiyhas-w4auuzv-.jpeg?w=300 300w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/eiyhas-w4auuzv-.jpeg?w=768 768w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/eiyhas-w4auuzv-.jpeg?w=1440 1440w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" /></figure>



<p>Isabelle at The Shaggy Shepherd: &#8220;Legacy of Ash is my first experience with Matthew Ward’s writing and I am blown away. His world-building, which was a big focus of this first book in this series, is amazing. It lays out both the setting as well as the class system in great detail.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">The Ember Blade &#8211; 824 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3911" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/dntvsmqw0aatdx1/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dntvsmqw0aatdx1.jpeg" data-orig-size="2094,1960" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="DnTVsmqW0AAtdx1" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dntvsmqw0aatdx1.jpeg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dntvsmqw0aatdx1.jpeg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="958" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dntvsmqw0aatdx1.jpeg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-3911" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dntvsmqw0aatdx1.jpeg?w=1024 1024w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dntvsmqw0aatdx1.jpeg?w=2048 2048w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dntvsmqw0aatdx1.jpeg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dntvsmqw0aatdx1.jpeg?w=300 300w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dntvsmqw0aatdx1.jpeg?w=768 768w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/dntvsmqw0aatdx1.jpeg?w=1440 1440w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" /></figure>



<p>James Bella-Vardon for Grimdark Magazine: &#8220;The quality of writing is extraordinary, holding its own with any literary novel while not using hard words for the sake of it. The character building and plot twists are divine. The Grimdark element is present throughout, with real consequences for each of the characters’ actions and there being no convenient quick fixes or sudden deus ex machina moments to dilute the suspense which is ratcheted up further with each page turned. Wooding’s world is also possessed of a magic which is soft but intensely deep and powerful, with far-reaching consequences.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">A Game of Thrones &#8211; 816 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3910" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/il_1080xn-3708844938_h4zp/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/il_1080xn.3708844938_h4zp.jpg" data-orig-size="1080,813" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="il_1080xN.3708844938_h4zp" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/il_1080xn.3708844938_h4zp.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/il_1080xn.3708844938_h4zp.jpg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="770" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/il_1080xn.3708844938_h4zp.jpg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-3910" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/il_1080xn.3708844938_h4zp.jpg?w=1024 1024w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/il_1080xn.3708844938_h4zp.jpg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/il_1080xn.3708844938_h4zp.jpg?w=300 300w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/il_1080xn.3708844938_h4zp.jpg?w=768 768w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/il_1080xn.3708844938_h4zp.jpg 1080w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" /></figure>



<p>Mark Lawrence: &#8220;</p>



<p>I maintain that not only is Game of Thrones a brilliant read, it&#8217;s also an important one for the genre. It&#8217;s meaningful to talk about post-GRRM fantasy.</p>



<p>For many people, indeed for a decent chunk of a whole. generation of fantasy authors, George RR Martin&#8217;s A Game of Thrones was a step change in the genre.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">The Priory of the Orange Tree &#8211; 848 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3892" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/5l9a7284_2048x/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/5l9a7284_2048x.jpg" data-orig-size="2048,1365" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;1&quot;}" data-image-title="5L9A7284_2048x" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/5l9a7284_2048x.jpg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/5l9a7284_2048x.jpg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="682" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/5l9a7284_2048x.jpg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-3892" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/5l9a7284_2048x.jpg?w=1024 1024w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/5l9a7284_2048x.jpg 2048w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/5l9a7284_2048x.jpg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/5l9a7284_2048x.jpg?w=300 300w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/5l9a7284_2048x.jpg?w=768 768w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/5l9a7284_2048x.jpg?w=1440 1440w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" /></figure>



<p>James Tivendale for Grimdark Magazine: &#8220;The Priory of the Orange Tree is incredibly detailed, neatly composed and has more stunning set-pieces, outstanding moments and unexpected twists that most epic fantasy trilogies.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Master Artificer &#8211; 866 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3909" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/47382ma_1/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/47382ma_1.jpg" data-orig-size="800,1132" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="47382MA_1" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/47382ma_1.jpg?w=212" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/47382ma_1.jpg?w=724" loading="lazy" width="724" height="1024" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/47382ma_1.jpg?w=724" alt="" class="wp-image-3909" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/47382ma_1.jpg?w=724 724w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/47382ma_1.jpg?w=106 106w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/47382ma_1.jpg?w=212 212w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/47382ma_1.jpg?w=768 768w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/47382ma_1.jpg 800w" sizes="(max-width: 724px) 100vw, 724px" /></figure>



<p>Traveling Cloak: &#8220;Master Artificer is an absolute home run of a sequel. Everything &#8211; from the magic, to the storylines, the world building, the emotion &#8211; is bigger and better than the first book, which was already incredibly epic in scope. Master Artificer was one of my favorite reads of 2022.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Of Darkness and Light &#8211; 912 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3929" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/fsedu-2xsaej-q0/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/fsedu-2xsaej-q0.jpeg" data-orig-size="2048,2048" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="FsEdu-2XsAEj-Q0" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/fsedu-2xsaej-q0.jpeg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/fsedu-2xsaej-q0.jpeg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="1024" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/fsedu-2xsaej-q0.jpeg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-3929" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/fsedu-2xsaej-q0.jpeg?w=1024 1024w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/fsedu-2xsaej-q0.jpeg 2048w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/fsedu-2xsaej-q0.jpeg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/fsedu-2xsaej-q0.jpeg?w=300 300w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/fsedu-2xsaej-q0.jpeg?w=768 768w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/fsedu-2xsaej-q0.jpeg?w=1440 1440w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" /></figure>



<p>Wolfmantula: &#8220;This thicc baby is JUICY and starts off full throttle putting you right into the thick of it! It’s action packed, intense, full of fury and rage, with perfectly timed humor. It has a gritty darkness to it, but above all else it has a message of hope, a perfect marriage of both dark and light fantasy that can only be described as GrimHeart.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">The Hands of the Emperor &#8211; 969 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3927" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/image_editor_output_image-61373740-1680345202582/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/image_editor_output_image-61373740-1680345202582.png" data-orig-size="1080,571" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="image_editor_output_image-61373740-1680345202582" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/image_editor_output_image-61373740-1680345202582.png?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/image_editor_output_image-61373740-1680345202582.png?w=750" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="541" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/image_editor_output_image-61373740-1680345202582.png?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-3927" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/image_editor_output_image-61373740-1680345202582.png?w=1024 1024w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/image_editor_output_image-61373740-1680345202582.png?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/image_editor_output_image-61373740-1680345202582.png?w=300 300w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/image_editor_output_image-61373740-1680345202582.png?w=768 768w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/image_editor_output_image-61373740-1680345202582.png 1080w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" /></figure>



<p>Alexandra Rowland: &#8220;It has a burning core of fierce righteousness and a belief that good people doing hard, thankless work can make the world BETTER&#8230;Please, please, please read this book. This is my favorite, favorite book. I have not had a favorite book in years, but this is it.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Dragon Mage &#8211; 986 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3895" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/er9yfjuuwaa6cmw/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/er9yfjuuwaa6cmw.jpeg" data-orig-size="2048,1536" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="Er9YfJuUwAA6cmW" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/er9yfjuuwaa6cmw.jpeg?w=300" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/er9yfjuuwaa6cmw.jpeg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="1024" height="768" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/er9yfjuuwaa6cmw.jpeg?w=1024" alt="" class="wp-image-3895" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/er9yfjuuwaa6cmw.jpeg?w=1024 1024w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/er9yfjuuwaa6cmw.jpeg 2048w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/er9yfjuuwaa6cmw.jpeg?w=150 150w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/er9yfjuuwaa6cmw.jpeg?w=300 300w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/er9yfjuuwaa6cmw.jpeg?w=768 768w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/er9yfjuuwaa6cmw.jpeg?w=1440 1440w" sizes="(max-width: 1024px) 100vw, 1024px" /></figure>



<p>PL Stuart for Before We Go Blog: &#8220;This book far exceeds the nominal five star rating, so no point in trying to assign it one here. The best compliment I can give Dragon Mage, by M.L. Spencer is: Dragon Mage is why I read, and love, epic fantasy.&#8221;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">The Way of Kings &#8211; 1007 pages</h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="3894" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/1422729172-0-x/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/1422729172.0.x.jpg" data-orig-size="2833,3777" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;2.8&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;iPhone 7 Plus&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;1630769023&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;6.6&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;32&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0.016666666666667&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;1&quot;,&quot;latitude&quot;:&quot;37.896094444444&quot;,&quot;longitude&quot;:&quot;-122.29734722222&quot;}" data-image-title="1422729172.0.x" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/1422729172.0.x.jpg?w=225" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/1422729172.0.x.jpg?w=750" loading="lazy" width="768" height="1023" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/1422729172.0.x.jpg?w=768" alt="" class="wp-image-3894" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/1422729172.0.x.jpg?w=768 768w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/1422729172.0.x.jpg?w=1536 1536w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/1422729172.0.x.jpg?w=113 113w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/1422729172.0.x.jpg?w=225 225w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/1422729172.0.x.jpg?w=1440 1440w" sizes="(max-width: 768px) 100vw, 768px" /></figure>



<p>Alicia at Shethereader: &#8220;I&#8217;m floored by how Sanderson deals with deep topics without coming across as preachy. The characters have a way of encountering questions in life that I myself contemplate. It&#8217;s unsettling. It&#8217;s commonly mentioned in reviews that mental health is a big focus in this book. That was impactful, but more so was I really caught up by the examination of life before death &#8211; journey before destination. It ripped open some philosophical questions that I&#8217;ve been trying very hard to ignore and threw my heart and soul under a microscope.&#8217;</p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<h2 class="wp-block-heading">Ash: A Secret History &#8211; 1632 pages </h2>



<figure class="wp-block-image size-large"><img data-attachment-id="4444" data-permalink="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/2023/04/01/chonks-25-big-fantasy-books/91mtpezmy5l-_ac_uf8941000_ql80_/" data-orig-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/91mtpezmy5l._ac_uf8942c1000_ql80_.jpg" data-orig-size="661,1000" data-comments-opened="1" data-image-meta="{&quot;aperture&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;credit&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;camera&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;caption&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;created_timestamp&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;copyright&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;focal_length&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;iso&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;shutter_speed&quot;:&quot;0&quot;,&quot;title&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;orientation&quot;:&quot;0&quot;}" data-image-title="91MtPezmy5L._AC_UF894,1000_QL80_" data-image-description="" data-image-caption="" data-medium-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/91mtpezmy5l._ac_uf8942c1000_ql80_.jpg?w=198" data-large-file="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/91mtpezmy5l._ac_uf8942c1000_ql80_.jpg?w=661" loading="lazy" width="661" height="1000" src="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/91mtpezmy5l._ac_uf8942c1000_ql80_.jpg?w=661" alt="" class="wp-image-4444" srcset="https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/91mtpezmy5l._ac_uf8942c1000_ql80_.jpg 661w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/91mtpezmy5l._ac_uf8942c1000_ql80_.jpg?w=99 99w, https://spellsandspaceships.home.blog/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/91mtpezmy5l._ac_uf8942c1000_ql80_.jpg?w=198 198w" sizes="(max-width: 661px) 100vw, 661px" /></figure>



<p>&#8220;The first thing that should probably be said about Ash: A Secret History is that it&#8217;s probably the apex of the epic fantasy genre &#8211; or at least, the best thing written in the genre since The Lord of the Rings&#8221; &#8211; Goodreads review from <em>Wastrel</em></p>



<hr class="wp-block-separator has-alpha-channel-opacity" />



<p>Is your fave chonk on the list? Any that need to be there? Feel free to comment and let me know what you thought of the post!</p>

			4 thoughts on &ldquo;<span>CHONKS: 25 BIG Fantasy&nbsp;Books</span>&rdquo;		</h2><!-- .comments-title -->

</script>
<script type="text/javascript" src="//0.gravatar.com/js/hovercards/hovercards.min.js?ver=202601924dcd77a86c6f1d3698ec27fc5da92b28585ddad3ee636c0397cf312193b2a1" id="grofiles-cards-js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript" id="wpgroho-js-extra">
/* <![CDATA[ */
var WPGroHo = {"my_hash":""};
//# sourceURL=wpgroho-js-extra
/* ]]> */
</script>
<script crossorigin='anonymous' type='text/javascript'  src='/wp-content/mu-plugins/gravatar-hovercards/wpgroho.js?m=1610363240i'></script>

	<script>
		// Initialize and attach hovercards to all gravatars
		( function() {
			function init() {
				if ( typeof Gravatar === 'undefined' ) {
					return;
				}

				if ( typeof Gravatar.init !== 'function' ) {
					return;
				}

				Gravatar.profile_cb = function ( hash, id ) {
					WPGroHo.syncProfileData( hash, id );
				};

				Gravatar.my_hash = WPGroHo.my_hash;
				Gravatar.init(
					'body',
					'#wp-admin-bar-my-account',
					{
						i18n: {
							'Edit your profile →': 'Edit your profile →',
							'View profile →': 'View profile →',
							'Contact': 'Contact',
							'Send money': 'Send money',
							'Sorry, we are unable to load this Gravatar profile.': 'Sorry, we are unable to load this Gravatar profile.',
							'Gravatar not found.': 'Gravatar not found.',
							'Too Many Requests.': 'Too Many Requests.',
							'Internal Server Error.': 'Internal Server Error.',
							'Is this you?': 'Is this you?',
							'Claim your free profile.': 'Claim your free profile.',
							'Email': 'Email',
							'Home Phone': 'Home Phone',
							'Work Phone': 'Work Phone',
							'Cell Phone': 'Cell Phone',
							'Contact Form': 'Contact Form',
							'Calendar': 'Calendar',
						},
					}
				);
			}

			if ( document.readyState !== 'loading' ) {
				init();
			} else {
				document.addEventListener( 'DOMContentLoaded', init );
			}
		} )();
	</script>

		<div style="display:none">
	<div class="grofile-hash-map-b18f9d94e701ad5c703ab516ed918888">
	</div>
	<div class="grofile-hash-map-95ad7df8f5c4215bfc572318dd7d989f">
	</div>
	<div class="grofile-hash-map-d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e">
	</div>
	</div>
		<!-- CCPA [start] -->
		<script type="text/javascript">
			( function () {

				var setupPrivacy = function() {

					// Minimal Mozilla Cookie library
					// https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Document/cookie/Simple_document.cookie_framework
					var cookieLib = window.cookieLib = {getItem:function(e){return e&&decodeURIComponent(document.cookie.replace(new RegExp("(?:(?:^|.*;)\\s*"+encodeURIComponent(e).replace(/[\-\.\+\*]/g,"\\$&")+"\\s*\\=\\s*([^;]*).*$)|^.*$"),"$1"))||null},setItem:function(e,o,n,t,r,i){if(!e||/^(?:expires|max\-age|path|domain|secure)$/i.test(e))return!1;var c="";if(n)switch(n.constructor){case Number:c=n===1/0?"; expires=Fri, 31 Dec 9999 23:59:59 GMT":"; max-age="+n;break;case String:c="; expires="+n;break;case Date:c="; expires="+n.toUTCString()}return"rootDomain"!==r&&".rootDomain"!==r||(r=(".rootDomain"===r?".":"")+document.location.hostname.split(".").slice(-2).join(".")),document.cookie=encodeURIComponent(e)+"="+encodeURIComponent(o)+c+(r?"; domain="+r:"")+(t?"; path="+t:"")+(i?"; secure":""),!0}};

					// Implement IAB USP API.
					window.__uspapi = function( command, version, callback ) {

						// Validate callback.
						if ( typeof callback !== 'function' ) {
							return;
						}

						// Validate the given command.
						if ( command !== 'getUSPData' || version !== 1 ) {
							callback( null, false );
							return;
						}

						// Check for GPC. If set, override any stored cookie.
						if ( navigator.globalPrivacyControl ) {
							callback( { version: 1, uspString: '1YYN' }, true );
							return;
						}

						// Check for cookie.
						var consent = cookieLib.getItem( 'usprivacy' );

						// Invalid cookie.
						if ( null === consent ) {
							callback( null, false );
							return;
						}

						// Everything checks out. Fire the provided callback with the consent data.
						callback( { version: 1, uspString: consent }, true );
					};

					// Initialization.
					document.addEventListener( 'DOMContentLoaded', function() {

						// Internal functions.
						var setDefaultOptInCookie = function() {
							var value = '1YNN';
							var domain = '.wordpress.com' === location.hostname.slice( -14 ) ? '.rootDomain' : location.hostname;
							cookieLib.setItem( 'usprivacy', value, 365 * 24 * 60 * 60, '/', domain );
						};

						var setDefaultOptOutCookie = function() {
							var value = '1YYN';
							var domain = '.wordpress.com' === location.hostname.slice( -14 ) ? '.rootDomain' : location.hostname;
							cookieLib.setItem( 'usprivacy', value, 24 * 60 * 60, '/', domain );
						};

						var setDefaultNotApplicableCookie = function() {
							var value = '1---';
							var domain = '.wordpress.com' === location.hostname.slice( -14 ) ? '.rootDomain' : location.hostname;
							cookieLib.setItem( 'usprivacy', value, 24 * 60 * 60, '/', domain );
						};

						var setCcpaAppliesCookie = function( applies ) {
							var domain = '.wordpress.com' === location.hostname.slice( -14 ) ? '.rootDomain' : location.hostname;
							cookieLib.setItem( 'ccpa_applies', applies, 24 * 60 * 60, '/', domain );
						}

						var maybeCallDoNotSellCallback = function() {
							if ( 'function' === typeof window.doNotSellCallback ) {
								return window.doNotSellCallback();
							}

							return false;
						}

						// Look for usprivacy cookie first.
						var usprivacyCookie = cookieLib.getItem( 'usprivacy' );

						// Found a usprivacy cookie.
						if ( null !== usprivacyCookie ) {

							// If the cookie indicates that CCPA does not apply, then bail.
							if ( '1---' === usprivacyCookie ) {
								return;
							}

							// CCPA applies, so call our callback to add Do Not Sell link to the page.
							maybeCallDoNotSellCallback();

							// We're all done, no more processing needed.
							return;
						}

						// We don't have a usprivacy cookie, so check to see if we have a CCPA applies cookie.
						var ccpaCookie = cookieLib.getItem( 'ccpa_applies' );

						// No CCPA applies cookie found, so we'll need to geolocate if this visitor is from California.
						// This needs to happen client side because we do not have region geo data in our $SERVER headers,
						// only country data -- therefore we can't vary cache on the region.
						if ( null === ccpaCookie ) {

							var request = new XMLHttpRequest();
							request.open( 'GET', 'https://public-api.wordpress.com/geo/', true );

							request.onreadystatechange = function () {
								if ( 4 === this.readyState ) {
									if ( 200 === this.status ) {

										// Got a geo response. Parse out the region data.
										var data = JSON.parse( this.response );
										var region      = data.region ? data.region.toLowerCase() : '';
										var ccpa_applies = ['california', 'colorado', 'connecticut', 'delaware', 'indiana', 'iowa', 'montana', 'new jersey', 'oregon', 'tennessee', 'texas', 'utah', 'virginia'].indexOf( region ) > -1;
										// Set CCPA applies cookie. This keeps us from having to make a geo request too frequently.
										setCcpaAppliesCookie( ccpa_applies );

										// Check if CCPA applies to set the proper usprivacy cookie.
										if ( ccpa_applies ) {
											if ( maybeCallDoNotSellCallback() ) {
												// Do Not Sell link added, so set default opt-in.
												setDefaultOptInCookie();
											} else {
												// Failed showing Do Not Sell link as required, so default to opt-OUT just to be safe.
												setDefaultOptOutCookie();
											}
										} else {
											// CCPA does not apply.
											setDefaultNotApplicableCookie();
										}
									} else {
										// Could not geo, so let's assume for now that CCPA applies to be safe.
										setCcpaAppliesCookie( true );
										if ( maybeCallDoNotSellCallback() ) {
											// Do Not Sell link added, so set default opt-in.
											setDefaultOptInCookie();
										} else {
											// Failed showing Do Not Sell link as required, so default to opt-OUT just to be safe.
											setDefaultOptOutCookie();
										}
									}
								}
							};

							// Send the geo request.
							request.send();
						} else {
							// We found a CCPA applies cookie.
							if ( ccpaCookie === 'true' ) {
								if ( maybeCallDoNotSellCallback() ) {
									// Do Not Sell link added, so set default opt-in.
									setDefaultOptInCookie();
								} else {
									// Failed showing Do Not Sell link as required, so default to opt-OUT just to be safe.
									setDefaultOptOutCookie();
								}
							} else {
								// CCPA does not apply.
								setDefaultNotApplicableCookie();
							}
						}
					} );
				};

				// Kickoff initialization.
				if ( window.defQueue && defQueue.isLOHP && defQueue.isLOHP === 2020 ) {
					defQueue.items.push( setupPrivacy );
				} else {
					setupPrivacy();
				}

			} )();
		</script>

		<!-- CCPA [end] -->
				<div id="actionbar" dir="ltr" style="display: none;"
			class="actnbr-pub-maywood actnbr-has-follow actnbr-has-actions">

						</a>
					</li>

			var wpcom_reblog = {
				source: 'toolbar',

				toggle_reblog_box_flair: function (obj_id, post_id) {

					// Go to site selector. This will redirect to their blog if they only have one.
					const postEndpoint = `https://wordpress.com/post`;

					// Ideally we would use the permalink here, but fortunately this will be replaced with the 
					// post permalink in the editor.
					const originalURL = `${ document.location.href }?page_id=${ post_id }`; 
					
					const url =
						postEndpoint +
						'?url=' +
						encodeURIComponent( originalURL ) +
						'&is_post_share=true' +
						'&v=5';

					const redirect = function () {
						if (
							! window.open( url, '_blank' )
						) {
							location.href = url;
						}
					};

					if ( /Firefox/.test( navigator.userAgent ) ) {
						setTimeout( redirect, 0 );
					} else {
						redirect();
					}
				},
			};

			window.wpcom_reblog = wpcom_reblog;
		})();
	</script>

var windowOpen;
			( function () {
				function matches( el, sel ) {
					return !! (
						el.matches && el.matches( sel ) ||
						el.msMatchesSelector && el.msMatchesSelector( sel )
					);
				}

				document.body.addEventListener( 'click', function ( event ) {
					if ( ! event.target ) {
						return;
					}

					var el;
					if ( matches( event.target, 'a.share-twitter' ) ) {
						el = event.target;
					} else if ( event.target.parentNode && matches( event.target.parentNode, 'a.share-twitter' ) ) {
						el = event.target.parentNode;
					}

					if ( el ) {
						event.preventDefault();

						// If there's another sharing window open, close it.
						if ( typeof windowOpen !== 'undefined' ) {
							windowOpen.close();
						}
						windowOpen = window.open( el.getAttribute( 'href' ), 'wpcomtwitter', 'menubar=1,resizable=1,width=600,height=350' );
						return false;
					}
				} );
			} )();
